titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Michael Lerner Collection on MAD Magazine research, 1951-2005 SPEC.CGA.MLM
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by BICLM Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Ohio State University Libraries Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-09-22T08:36-0400

did.unittitle: Michael Lerner Collection on Mad Magazine Research

repository.corpname: Ohio State University Libraries Special Collections

did.abstract: This collection contains articles and clipping, other types of publications, recordings of television and radio programs that reference some aspect of Mad Magazine, whether its history, artists, founder, subject matter, or contribution to popular culture. The collection was assembled by Michael Lerner, an enthusiast of Mad magazine and popular culture collector.
did.physdesc: The collection consists of 20 pamphlet file boxes, 4 record cartons, 5 flat file boxes, and 4 Hollinger boxes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Michael Lerner Collection on MAD Magazine Research, 1951 to 2005, contains articles, television, and radio programs that reference some aspect of Mad Magazine, whether its history, artists, founder, subject matter, or contribution to popular culture. The collection was assembled by Michael Lerner an enthusiast of Mad magazine and popular culture collector.

The collection consists of two series, Audiovisual and Articles. The Audiovisual Series contains segments of television news programs that feature content on Mad Magazine or television programs in which a reference is made to Mad. Also included is the Mad Show Skits that appeared on the Ed Sullivan program in 1966, in addition to several taped episodes of the comedy sketch program Mad TV that aired on FOX in the 1990s. Also in the Audiovisual Series are segements of radion programs in which Mad magazine artists were interviewed or announced the 1992 death of Mad founder William M. Gaines. The material in the Audiovisual Series was recorded by the collection's creator from broadcast programs for his personal research. The material is all magnetic media and is in fair condition. It may need to be evaluted by BICLM for durabilty before being played on a VHS or audiocassette player.

The series Articles in divided into two subseries based on format of the materials and contains articles about Mad magazine or references to Mad magazine, either its artists, creator, or characters (for example many articles show the character Alfred E. Neuman or his catch phrase "What, me worry?"). Information on the articles including title of publication, article title, date, and brief description of subject matter was gathered from a spreadsheet originally compiled by the collection's creator and later provided to BICLM staff. The subseries, Articles in Publications contains intact magazines with the title the publication, followed by the article title in quotations. If known, the page number of the article and a brief description of the subject matter will appear in a scope note for the item. The other subseries, Article Clippings are loose clippings of articles and when possible the publication title, article title, and date have been listed.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of Materials
arrangement.p:
This collection is arranged in 2 series:
Series 1: Audiovisual, 1966-1998 Series 2: Articles, 1951-2005 Subseries 1: Articles in Publications, 1951-2000 Subseries 2: Article Clippings, 1967-2005

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], (Box number/ Folder number), Michael Lerner Collection on MAD Magazine Research, SPEC.CGA.MLM, Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum, The Ohio State University

accessrestrict.head: Access to Materials
accessrestrict.p: Materials in this collection are available for use, but may be used in the Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum reading room only. Audiovisual materials may need a use copy produced before access is allowed. Contact the Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum reading room for more information.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Michael Lerner is a collector of Mad magazine memorabilia materials living in Shaker Heights, OH.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Sydney Miller, June 2016; Wendy Pflug, June 2016 to January 2017; Joshua Fischer, February 2017; Megan Sand, September 2017

userestrict.head: Use of Materials
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be protected by copyright, and are made available for research and educational purposes. In general, the OSU Libraries do not own the copyright for materials from our collections and cannot grant copyright permissions for these materials. The user is responsible for making a final determination of copyright status. If copyright protection applies, permission must be obtained from the copyright holder to reuse, publish, or reproduce the work beyond the bounds of fair use or other exceptions to the law. Works in the public domain are not protected by copyright and do not require permission to use.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The collection includes VHS video cassette tapes and audio cassette tapes and is in fair condition. The audiovisual material requires a television and VHS player and audiocassette taper player to access the material. Please note the audiovisual material in in fair condition and will need to be evaluted by a BICLM staff member prior to use.
